devdoc.details: Provides NFT marketplace functionality for the Gemforce diamond.      This facet enables users to list, purchase, and delist NFTs with      support for both ETH and ERC20 token payments. It includes a      configurable fee distribution system where a portion of each sale      can be sent to multiple fee receivers.      The facet interacts with the IdentitySystemStorage for NFT transfers      and marketplace state management. It implements reentrancy protection      via the ReentrancyGuard to ensure security during payment operations.

SafeERC20FailedOperation(address).details: An operation with an ERC-20 token failed.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

MarketplaceInitialized((address,uint256).details: Emitted when the marketplace is initialized with fee receivers

params.feeReceivers: Array of fee receivers with their shares

PaymentDistributed(address,address,uint2.details: Emitted when a payment is distributed to a receiver

params.amount: Amount of tokens or ETH distributed
params.token: Address of the token used for payment (address(0) for ETH)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

delistItem(address,uint256).custom:event: Emits Delisted event upon successful delisting
delistItem(address,uint256).custom:security: Uses nonReentrant modifier to prevent reentrancy attacks
delistItem(address,uint256).details: Allows the seller of a listed NFT to delist it, canceling the sale.      This function returns ownership and control of the NFT to the seller      if it was previously transferred to the contract. Only the original      seller or the contract itself can delist an item, and it must not have      been sold already. The function implements nonReentrant modifier to      prevent potential reentrancy attacks during execution.      The delisting process:      1. Verifies the item exists and hasn't been sold      2. Checks caller is the seller or the contract itself      3. Resets listing variables and removes from active listings      4. Transfers NFT back to seller if it was held by the contract The first parameter (address) is unused but kept for interface compatibility.

params.tokenId: The ID of the NFT to delist

returns._0: Array of marketplace fee receivers with their shares

initializeMarketplace((address,uint256)[.custom:security: Only callable by the contract owner
initializeMarketplace((address,uint256)[.details: Sets up the fee distribution system for the marketplace. Once initialized,      it cannot be modified. This one-time setup defines what percentage of each      sale will go to different recipients (e.g., platform fees, community treasury).      The sum of all fee shares must not exceed 100% (1,000,000 parts per million).

params._feeReceivers: Array of fee receivers with their respective shares

listItem(address,address,uint256,uint256.custom:event: Emits Listings event with listing details
listItem(address,address,uint256,uint256.custom:security: Uses nonReentrant modifier to prevent reentrancy attacks
listItem(address,address,uint256,uint256.details: Creates a new market item listing for the specified NFT. The NFT can either      remain in the seller's wallet or be transferred to the contract based on      the transferNFT parameter. This function implements the nonReentrant modifier      to prevent potential reentrancy attacks during execution.      The first parameter is unused but kept for interface compatibility.

params.paymentToken: Address of ERC20 token for payment, or address(0) for ETH
params.price: The listing price (in ETH or ERC20 tokens)
params.receiver: The address that will receive payment when item is sold
params.tokenId: The ID of the NFT being listed
params.transferNFT: If true, transfers the NFT to the contract; if false, keeps it with seller

purchaseItem(address,uint256,uint256).custom:event: Emits Sales event upon successful purchase
purchaseItem(address,uint256,uint256).custom:payment: Accepts ETH (if paymentToken is address(0)) or ERC20 tokens
purchaseItem(address,uint256,uint256).custom:security: Uses nonReentrant modifier and checks-effects-interactions pattern
purchaseItem(address,uint256,uint256).details: Allows a registered user to purchase a listed NFT, handling both ETH and ERC20 payments.      The function follows the checks-effects-interactions pattern for security, updating      state variables before transferring tokens or NFTs. A portion of the payment is      distributed to configured fee receivers, with the remainder going to the listing's      payment receiver. The function implements nonReentrant modifier to prevent reentrancy attacks.      The purchase process:      1. Verifies the listing exists and hasn't been sold      2. Checks buyer is registered in the identity system      3. Validates sufficient payment was provided      4. Updates state to mark item as sold      5. Transfers NFT to buyer      6. Distributes payment to fee receivers and seller      The first parameter (address) is unused but kept for interface compatibility.

params.tokenId: The ID of the NFT to purchase

feeReceivers.details: Array of fee receivers who get a percentage of each sale

devdoc.title: MarketplaceFacet

delistItem(address,uint256).notice: Remove an NFT from the marketplace listings

getMarketplaceFeeReceivers().notice: Get the fee receivers configured specifically for this marketplace

initializeMarketplace((address,uint256)[.notice: Initialize the marketplace with fee receivers

listItem(address,address,uint256,uint256.notice: List an NFT for sale in the marketplace

purchaseItem(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Purchase a listed NFT from the marketplace
